questions.question: How many children does a binary tree have?
What is/are the disadvantages of implementing tree using normal arrays?
questions.a: Difficulty in knowing children nodes of a node
questions.b: Difficulty in finding the parent of a node
questions.c: Have to know the maximum number of nodes possible before creation of trees

questions.question: What is a hash table?
questions.a: A structure that maps values to keys
questions.b: A structure that maps keys to values
questions.d: A structure used to implement stacks and queues

questions.question: What does ‘stack underflow’ refer to?
questions.a: Accessing item from an undefined stack
questions.b: Adding items to a full stack
questions.c: Removing items from an empty stack

questions.question: What is a bit array?
questions.a: Data structure for representing arrays of records
questions.b: Data structure that compactly stores bits
questions.c: An array in which most of the elements have the same value
questions.d: Array in which elements are not present in continuous locations

questions.question: Why is implementation of stack operations on queues not feasible for a large dataset (Assume the number of elements in the stack to be n)?
questions.a: Because of its time complexity O(n)
questions.b: Because of its time complexity O(log(n))

questions.question: Which of the following statements for a simple graph is correct?
questions.c: Every trail is a path as well as every path is a trail
questions.d: Path and trail have no relation

questions.question: The number of elements in the adjacency matrix of a graph having 7 vertices is...
Which of these adjacency matrices represents a simple graph?
Express -15 as a 6-bit signed binary number
